StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI GO-ESP: Heart Cohorts Exome Sequencing Project (Ischemic Stroke Genetics Study, ISGS)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: A sample statement for the acknowledgment of the ISGS dataset(s) follows: “This study is part of the NHLBI Grand Opportunity Exome Sequencing Project (GO-ESP). Funding for GO-ESP was provided by NHLBI grants RC2 HL103010 (HeartGO), RC2 HL102923 (LungGO) and RC2 HL102924 (WHISP). The exome sequencing and ExomeChip genotyping was performed through NHLBI grants RC2 HL102925 (BroadGO) and RC2 HL102926 (SeattleGO). We gratefully acknowledge the Ischemic Stroke Genetics Study (ISGS) who provided biological samples and data for this study. ISGS was supported by grant R01-NS42733 from the NIH/NINDS.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Stroke and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. The informed consent document signed by ISGS participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit and for-profit organizations. These data may be used by private companies in the development of diagnostics and therapeutics under the current consent. For the ISGS participants, this consent group requires full or expedited IRB approval. ISGS data may only be used to investigate stroke and stroke-related disorders. The ISGS data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures, individual participant genotypes, phenotype-only analyses, or issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity; all research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. population consistent with the demographic distribution in the ISGS cohort.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Stroke, IRB, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-STK-IRB-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Stroke and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
The informed consent document signed by ISGS participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit and for-profit organizations. These data may be used by private companies in the development of diagnostics and therapeutics under the current consent. For the ISGS participants, this consent group requires full or expedited IRB approval. ISGS data may only be used to investigate stroke and stroke-related disorders. The ISGS data may not be used to investigate individual pedigree structures, individual participant genotypes, phenotype-only analyses, or issues such as non-maternity and non-paternity; all research must be related to the etiology and prevention of morbidity and mortality of the U.S. population consistent with the demographic distribution in the ISGS cohort.
